image.altText: A concrete building reading "Law Courts of the Australian Capital Territory", with the Australian, ACT and Aboriginal flags.

props.synopsis: A Canberra man and woman are banned from owning a pet for 10 years after pleading guilty to animal cruelty.

title.children: Canberra pair banned from owning a pet after emaciated dog put down

image.altText: Trish cuts some wood using a tool, wearing ear muffs, a mask and high-vis.

props.synopsis: When Sunita Kotnala first came to Canberra, there was no women's shed, something she felt was needed. Now she helps other women gain the confidence to use power tools and make things with their hands.

title.children: Trish used to be 'petrified' of using power saws. Now she teaches woodworking

image.altText: A red rally car turning a corner with dust flying out the back.

props.synopsis: Motorsport fans lap up the first round of the Australian Rally Championship held in the forests surrounding Canberra, with Lewis Bates securing victory on home turf for the first time.

title.children: Rally driving moves up a gear as interest in motorsports surges

image.altText: A waitrees looks to the side as she holds a cup of coffee balanced on a saucer

props.synopsis: An expansion to the ACT's portable long service leave scheme, which allows those in casual or insecure work to access the entitlement even if they switch employers, is being put on hold amid the ongoing cost-of-living crisis.

title.children: 'Tough time' for businesses delays expansion of ACT leave scheme

image.altText: Ricky Stuart looks pensive with his hand on his chin

props.synopsis: Ricky Stuart says the NRL's crackdown on obstruction is over after Canberra was on the wrong end of a questionable bunker ruling.

title.children: Stuart furious with referee after Raiders defeat

image.altText: A man in a kayak holds onto a hot air balloon.

props.synopsis: During the Canberra Balloon Spectacular, pilot Justin Galbraith bounces the basket of his hot air balloon across the surface of Lake Burley Griffin and throws out a towline to pull along hundreds of kayakers and paddle-boarders in his wake.

title.children: Hot air balloons spending more time on the water as kayakers hitch a ride

image.altText: A backhoe clearing the hail from the road on the main street of town.

props.synopsis: It was already difficult to find a place to rent in Harden before a blast of extreme weather took a dozen homes off the market.

title.children: Renters with 'nowhere else to go' after storm smashes Riverina town

image.altText: A smartphone with an Airbnb logo on it in front of the same logo being projected on a screen.

props.synopsis: From July 1 short-term rental accommodation bookings of less than 28 days, made on booking services like Airbnb and Stayz, will pay a five per cent levy in the ACT.

title.children: Canberra short-term rental booking levy to 'level the playing field'

image.altText: A woman with short blonde hair holds up a moth-eaten knitted blanket.

props.synopsis: Releasing 10,000 of microscopic wasps into a home may not sound like the most obvious way to tackle a moth infestation, but it is an effective one.

title.children: These tiny wasps may help protect your clothes and pantry from moths

image.altText: Actor Gerard Depardieu attends a news conference and points his finger at the crowd.

props.synopsis: The French actor is facing trial in Paris after being accused of sexual assault by two women, allegations he has denied.

title.children: Gerard Depardieu trial a test for post-#MeToo France

image.altText: Anna Blight smiles, dressed in a black jacket for a professional portrait taken against a white background.

props.synopsis: Colleagues of Melbourne accountant Anna Blight say the 39-year-old's "passion, determination and kindness" inspired everyone around her, after Ms Blight's death in a Bali boat capsize on Friday,

title.children: 'Exceptional' Melbourne accountant killed in Bali boat capsize

image.altText: Cliff Young waves wearing 'Westfield' running T-shirt. He is colourised while the background is black and white

props.synopsis: Australians love an underdog and in 1983, Cliff Young transfixed the nation when he beat the world's best to shuffle to victory from Sydney to Melbourne. His legend endures.

title.children: How a 61yo potato farmer thrashed Australia's best ultramarathon runners

image.altText: Monique Ryan's husband is filmed removing rival a candidate's signage

props.synopsis: The husband of federal Victorian MP Monique Ryan has apologised after being filmed removing a sign belonging to rival Kooyong candidate Amelia Hamer.

title.children: Husband of federal MP apologises after removing political candidate's sign

image.altText: Albanese_Cabinet_3.3.3025_ABC07694

props.synopsis: Your attention is what politicians are seeking, and they will be reaching for it everywhere they possibly can in budget week.

title.children: Government has the momentum heading into budget week

image.altText: Police move search for Joanne Ratcliffe and Kirste Gordan

props.synopsis: A new private search is underway in the state's Mid North for Joanne Ratcliffe and Kirste Gordon, who went missing from Adelaide Oval more than 50 years ago.

title.children: New search begins in SA for children who went missing more than 50 years ago

image.altText: A man holding a Turkish flag protests

props.synopsis: The Istanbul mayor has been arrested. Hundreds of thousands of protesters are swarming the streets of Türkiye. How did we get here?

title.children: Five nights of protests and a jailed mayor: What is happening in Türkiye?

image.altText: Papua New Guinea Prime Minister James Marape points up with his right index finger.

props.synopsis: Seventy projects outlined in a confidential PNG cabinet document include acquiring a luxury island in partnership with a Congolese rapper, exploring the potential for a world-class Formula 1 track, creating a "Silicon Valley style hub" for entrepreneurs and setting up a spy agency with training from Israel.

title.children: 'Reads more like science fiction': PNG's wish list for the future slammed

image.altText: A middle-aged caucasian women with shoulder length blonde hair

props.synopsis: The mother of British transgender teen Brianna Ghey speaks out in support of a social media ban for children aged under 16.

title.children: 'Absolute cesspit': Mother of murdered teen backs under-16 social media ban

image.altText: Man on beach with four-wheel drive passing

props.synopsis: A global study finds there is "no environmentally safe level" of four-wheel drive use on beaches, prompting calls to severely limit access.

title.children: Calls for 4WD ban on the Australian beaches being 'pummelled to death'

image.altText: Lando Norris and Oscar Piastri at the Chinese Grand Prix talking in parc ferme, wearing their racing suits

props.synopsis: McLaren, the 2024 constructors' champions, has made the perfect start to the year with Lando Norris and Oscar Piastri claiming the first two grands prix of 2025.

title.children: Norris 'nervous and excited' as teammate Piastri claims F1 win

image.altText: A woman with long brown hair sits on a wooden chair.

props.synopsis: The unbelievable story of adoptive parents abandoning their child — because they thought she was actually a grown woman pretending to be a child — is getting the Hollywood treatment.

title.children: Natalia Grace was nine when her parents made her become a 23-year-old

image.altText: Kids in hi-vis vests enjoying the sunny view from a mountain overlooking green flat land, central Victoria.

props.synopsis: Once a rite of passage, overnight excursions for students in Victoria are becoming increasingly rare.

title.children: School camp has been a rite of passage but might be a thing of the past

image.altText: The causeway over Heirisson Island looking towards the city, 16 January 2015.

props.synopsis: Police are appealing for information after a woman was fatally injured when she was struck by a Transperth bus in East Perth on Sunday night.

title.children: Woman dies after stepping onto Perth's Causeway and being hit by bus

image.altText: Victoria Police is appealing for information after a man was shot in Fawkner

props.synopsis: Victoria Police say a man shot in the ankle in Melbourne last October was lured to the site under false pretences and was known to since-executed underworld figure Sam "The Punisher" Abdulrahim.

title.children: Melbourne tradie shot in daylight to suffer lifelong injury, police say

image.altText: Three people on an outback track near Oodnadatta.

props.synopsis: A rescue effort will be launched in South Australia's outback to retrieve four people who, according to police, prompted a "significant search" in the state's far north, where heavy rain has closed roads.

title.children: Rescue effort for group stranded in SA outback after heavy rain closes roads

image.altText: Text message graphic.

props.synopsis: Hobart tenant Katie found out the "sublet agreement" she had signed with a company called Arx Pty Ltd could be invalid — and she had no tenancy rights in Tasmania.

title.children: A sharehouse was run by a 'sublandlord' company. It could be unlawful

image.altText: A brown snake wraps around a bird from the gutter of a roof of a residential home.

props.synopsis: Surprised residents in WA's north-west called in the snake catcher when they found a 1.5-metre-long python devouring an unfortunate bird.

title.children: Pilbara python filmed swallowing pigeon whole

image.altText: Mum kissing her baby's hands

props.synopsis: There are several evidence-based advantages associated with late-age births — for both mum and bub — and experts say we should be talking about them more.

title.children: The surprising health benefits linked to having a baby later in life

image.altText: Mark Carney standing at a lectern and speaking, holding his hand up.

props.synopsis: The contest is expected to be dominated by Canada's increasingly tense relationship with US President Donald Trump, who has labelled the country America's "51st state".

title.children: Canadian prime minister calls snap election, days after being sworn in

image.altText: Steve Witkoff standing in the Oval Office speaking.

props.synopsis: European nations have rushed to boost defence spending in recent weeks, who fear the US is seeking to turn its back on them to pursue a deal with Russia.

title.children: Putin doesn't want to take 'all of Europe', US envoy says

image.altText: Smoke rises after an Israeli airstrike at Nasser hospital in Gaza

props.synopsis: The Palestinian Ministry of Health in Gaza says more than 50,000 people have been killed by Israel's bombardment and invasion of the Gaza Strip.

title.children: Israel air strike hits hospital in Gaza as death toll passes 50,000

image.altText: Fantasia Rose Portaminni 2

props.synopsis: The Northern Territory has the highest rate of kids in care in Australia. For those leaving care at 18 years old, it can be a confusing and scary time.

title.children: Teens struggle to adjust to adult life after leaving out-of-home care

image.altText: People putting sandbags together in preparation of an incoming storm.

props.synopsis: The Bureau of Meteorology forecast potential flooding on 14 rivers in northern NSW in the wake of ex-Cyclone Alfred. While only four actually did experience a major flood, data shows that several more were close, though all river heights were eclipsed by the catastrophic floods of early 2022.

title.children: NSW towns centimetres from major flooding due to Alfred, data shows

image.altText: Marlee, left, wears bright red and smiles while listening to Tamika, right, while holding mic to her.

props.synopsis: In just over an hour's run time, Skin in the Game ambitiously explores the big issues that plague rugby league and broader Australia, with Marlee Silva's own family story at its heart.

title.children: Rugby league's history of violence against women explored in new doco

image.altText: Lindsey Vonn cries and kisses a medal

props.synopsis: Lindsey Vonn becomes the oldest female alpine skiing medallist in a World Cup race just 11 months after having a partial knee replacement and six years after retiring.

title.children: 'Age is just a number' as Vonn creates skiing history
